meanings.definition: To put in danger or at risk.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the door unlocked could jeopardize our safety.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing a helmet while biking can jeopardize your head's protection.
meanings.sent3: Forgetting to bring an umbrella might jeopardize our picnic plans.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the warning signs could jeopardize your chances of success.
meanings.sent5: One small mistake can jeopardize the entire project.

meanings.definition: To expose to loss or injury.
meanings.sent1: Sharing your personal information online may jeopardize your privacy.
meanings.sent2: Leaving valuables in plain sight can jeopardize their security.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much candy could jeopardize your teeth's health.
meanings.sent4: Skipping regular check-ups may jeopardize your overall well-being.
meanings.sent5: A single wrong move can jeopardize the fragile balance of nature.
